newsitem.title: COTE D'IVOIRE: Ashanti Goldfields eyes Ivorian energy imports.
newsitem.headline: Ashanti Goldfields eyes Ivorian energy imports.

text.p: Ghana's Ashanti Goldfields is considering importing natural gas or electricity from neighbouring Ivory Coast to avoid energy supply shortfalls in Ghana, Ashanti said on Thursday.
"There has been an ever-increasing demand for power in Ghana and this is affecting the regular supply of power (to Ashanti)," Ashanti spokesman James Anaman told Reuters by telephone from Accra.
He said imports were more likely to be gas than electricity but price considerations would determine any final decision.
Ashanti managing director Sam Jonah, leading a mining and energy delegation which leaves on Thursday, had met Bedie and mines and energy minister Lamine Fadika to discuss options, Anaman added.
"We have just discussed opportunities available to Ashanti," he said.
Anaman said Jonah had also visited Ivory Coast's national petroleum company Petroci and U.S.-based United Meridian Corporation which is developing offshore Ivorian oil and gas.
Ashanti was also considering prospecting for gold in Ivory Coast, Jonah said during his visit to Ivory Coast this week which ends on Thursday, Anaman said.
Ivory Coast wants to broaden its farm-based economy by expanding mining, energy and food processing and has built up generating capacity to become a net exporter of electricity.
